intro: Pimpinella bisinuata, commonly known as the broadleaf cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant features slender, branched stems and pinnately divided leaves with a distinctive, feathery appearance. Its small, yellowish-white flowers are arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Pimpinella bisinuata is often found in meadows and woodland edges, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
